question_text: A bakery makes 15.9 cupcakes every minute! How many cupcakes can they bake in 20 minutes?\n
solution: This is a word problem asking for total cupcakes. Since they make/assemble 15.9 cupcakes per minute/hour, multiply by the number of minutes/hours: $15.9 \\times 20$
To multiply a decimal by a whole number, first multiply as if both were whole numbers. Treat 15.9 as 159.
Multiply: $159 \\times 20 = 3180$
Count decimal places in the original numbers. The number 15.9 has 1 decimal place, and 20 has 0 decimal places. Total: 1 decimal place.
Starting from the right of 3180, count 1 place to the left and put the decimal point there: 318.0
Therefore, the answer is 318.0 cupcakes.

Starting from the right of 534, count 1 place to the left and put the decimal point there: 53.400000000000006
Therefore, the answer is 53.400000000000006 cars.

question_text: A superhero saves 17.1 citizens every minute. How many citizens can they save in 17 minutes?\n
solution: This is a word problem asking for total items. Since they make/assemble 17.1 items per minute/hour, multiply by the number of minutes/hours: $17.1 \\times 17$
To multiply a decimal by a whole number, first multiply as if both were whole numbers. Treat 17.1 as 171.
Multiply: $171 \\times 17 = 2907$
Count decimal places in the original numbers. The number 17.1 has 1 decimal place, and 17 has 0 decimal places. Total: 1 decimal place.
Starting from the right of 2907, count 1 place to the left and put the decimal point there: 290.70000000000005
Therefore, the answer is 290.70000000000005 items.

question_text: A robot assembles 10.0 cars every minute. How many cars can they assemble in 8 minutes?\n
solution: This is a word problem asking for total cars. Since they make/assemble 10.0 cars per minute/hour, multiply by the number of minutes/hours: $10.0 \\times 8$
To multiply a decimal by a whole number, first multiply as if both were whole numbers. Treat 10.0 as 100.
Multiply: $100 \\times 8 = 800$
Count decimal places in the original numbers. The number 10.0 has 1 decimal place, and 8 has 0 decimal places. Total: 1 decimal place.
Starting from the right of 800, count 1 place to the left and put the decimal point there: 80.0
Therefore, the answer is 80.0 cars.

question_text: A video game developer codes 11.1 lines every minute. How many lines can they code in 15 minutes?\n
solution: This is a word problem asking for total items. Since they make/assemble 11.1 items per minute/hour, multiply by the number of minutes/hours: $11.1 \\times 15$
To multiply a decimal by a whole number, first multiply as if both were whole numbers. Treat 11.1 as 111.
Multiply: $111 \\times 15 = 1665$
Count decimal places in the original numbers. The number 11.1 has 1 decimal place, and 15 has 0 decimal places. Total: 1 decimal place.
Starting from the right of 1665, count 1 place to the left and put the decimal point there: 166.5
Therefore, the answer is 166.5 items.

question_text: A Pokemon trainer catches 3.7 Pokemon every minute. How many Pokemon can they catch in 8 minutes?\n
solution: This is a word problem asking for total items. Since they make/assemble 3.7 items per minute/hour, multiply by the number of minutes/hours: $3.7 \\times 8$
To multiply a decimal by a whole number, first multiply as if both were whole numbers. Treat 3.7 as 37.
Multiply: $37 \\times 8 = 296$
Count decimal places in the original numbers. The number 3.7 has 1 decimal place, and 8 has 0 decimal places. Total: 1 decimal place.
Starting from the right of 296, count 1 place to the left and put the decimal point there: 29.6
Therefore, the answer is 29.6 items.

solution: This is a word problem asking for total items. Since they make/assemble 19.7 items per minute/hour, multiply by the number of minutes/hours: $19.7 \\times 16$
To multiply a decimal by a whole number, first multiply as if both were whole numbers. Treat 19.7 as 197.

Count decimal places in the original numbers. The number 19.7 has 1 decimal place, and 16 has 0 decimal places. Total: 1 decimal place.
Starting from the right of 3152, count 1 place to the left and put the decimal point there: 315.2
Therefore, the answer is 315.2 items.

question_text: A manga artist draws 17.3 pages every minute. How many pages can they draw in 7 minutes?\n
solution: This is a word problem asking for total items. Since they make/assemble 17.3 items per minute/hour, multiply by the number of minutes/hours: $17.3 \\times 7$
To multiply a decimal by a whole number, first multiply as if both were whole numbers. Treat 17.3 as 173.
Multiply: $173 \\times 7 = 1211$
Count decimal places in the original numbers. The number 17.3 has 1 decimal place, and 7 has 0 decimal places. Total: 1 decimal place.
Starting from the right of 1211, count 1 place to the left and put the decimal point there: 121.10000000000001
Therefore, the answer is 121.10000000000001 items.
